sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a base length of 8cm and a base width of 5cm. The pyramid also has a height of 12cm. What is the volume of the pyramid in cubic centimeters?
message_2:
To find the volume of a rectangular pyramid, we can use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) * Base Area * Height

The base area of the pyramid is the product of its length and width:

Base Area = Length * Width = 8cm * 5cm = 40 square centimeters

Now, we can plug the base area and height into the formula:

Volume = (1/3) * 40cm² * 12cm = (40/3) * 12cm³ = 160cm³

The volume of the rectangular pyramid is 160 cubic centimeters.
